poem:
The Widow's Lament

In the quiet cries  
of morning paper,  
a name, Luke,  
fused to fate—  
dice echo  
in the hollow  
chest of chance,  
and Annie,  
a lone lament  
against the indifferent  
click of coins,  
calls out—  
but who listens  
as the wheel spins  
in shadowed silence?
